heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 21 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (185°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 47.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.0°C), outside temperature (up 3.3°C), and inside temperature (up 1.6°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 6%).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 40.3°C), feels like temperature (up 42.0°C), outside temperature (up 42.5°C), and cloud levels (up 139 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 495.0m higher than yesterday, 139.3m lower than the past week, 110.1m higher than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 741m to a maximum of 2070m, averaging 1819.4m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1958.7m and 1709.3m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and calm and still conditions are expected. Chance of light rain, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and bright sunshine will dominate the day. Little change in the weather.

washing.phrase: The sun is below the horizon, it is probably not the optimal time to be hanging out your washing.
